revised_title: An Inquiry into the Possibility of Restoring Life in Warm-Blooded Animals
tldr: The author investigates the possibility of restoring life in warm-blooded animals when respiration, circulation, and organic motion have ceased. Through a series of experiments, he explores artificial respiration, circulation, and the effects of temperature on the body, concluding that the motion of animals is produced by the force evolved in the process of combustion.
